feed.title: Your awesome title
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Mulled Wine
entry.content:
Made this as a little winter solstice beverage and it was fabulous! It comes together quickly, was incredibly aromatic, and tasted fabulous. It also stores super well in the fridge and reheats easily in the microwave if you want to make a batch ahead and enjoy the occasional mug over these cold winter nights. enjoy! 

Mulled Wine

Ingredients

2 large oranges

4 1/4 cups / 1 liter red wine

1 1/4 cups / 10 ounces brandy

1/2 cup dark brown sugar

2 cinnamon sticks

6 whole cloves

3 cardamom pods, slightly crushed

 

Directions

1. Using a peeler, remove the peel in strips from 1 orange then juice the orange. Slice the other orange into rounds and reserve for garnish.

2. In a nonreactive saucepan, combine orange peel, juice and the rest of the ingredients. Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes. Increase the heat to high, bring mixture to a boil, then immediately reduce the heat to low. Simmer gently until flavors meld, about 30 minutes. Strain the mixture, discarding the solids.

3. Ladle into cups or mugs. Garnish each with a reserved orange round.
entry.summary: Made this as a little winter solstice beverage and it was fabulous! It comes together quickly, was incredibly aromatic, and tasted fabulous. It also stores super well in the fridge and reheats easily in the microwave if you want to make a batch ahead and enjoy the occasional mug over these cold winter nights. enjoy! Mulled Wine

entry.title: Riso al Forno alla Pizzaiola aka Pizza Rice!

link.title: Riso al Forno alla Pizzaiola aka Pizza Rice!

entry.content:
I'm not gonna lie, this is not the most high-brow dish I've ever shared. That being said its easy and delicious and very comforting and IT DOES IN FACT TASTE LIKE PIZZA. you could easily add some chopped pepperoni or even calabrian chili peppers if you wanted. As is though its a delicious recipe, reheats great and I will definitely be making it on occasion to satisfy my inner child!



Riso al Forno alla Pizzaiola aka PIZZA RICE!

Ingredients

3 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil

2 garlic cloves, minced

6 to 7 fresh basil leaves, torn

1/2 to 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper (optional)

1 1/2 cups arborio rice

1 1/2 cups tomato passata or tomato purée

Salt and pepper

6 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, thinly sliced

1/2 cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano

 

Directions

1. Heat oven to 350 degrees.

2. In a medium saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium. Add the garlic, 3 of the torn basil leaves and the red pepper, if using. Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently to infuse the flavors and lightly brown the garlic.

3. Add the rice and continue to stir for 3 minutes, just until the rice begins to crackle and toast. Add 1¼ cups tomato passata and mix to coat. Add 2½ cups of water, 1 teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon fresh cracked pepper and bring to a boil over medium.

4. When the tomato mixture is boiling, turn down the heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes. Lift the lid and mix the rice every 5 minutes or so to prevent it from sticking to the bottom. After 20 minutes, remove it from the heat and stir in an additional ¼ cup of water and the remaining ¼ cup passata. (Your rice should look amply moist and creamy; it will continue to absorb more liquid as it bakes.)

5. Grease an 8- or 9-inch baking dish with the remaining oil. Pour the rice mixture into the dish (it will still be very al dente). Press the mozzarella slices into the rice. Sprinkle the grated Parmigiano evenly over the top.

6. Bake for 15 minutes in the middle of the oven. Then, move to the top rack and broil for 2 minutes. Remove from the oven, garnish with remaining basil and serve warm.
entry.summary: I'm not gonna lie, this is not the most high-brow dish I've ever shared. That being said its easy and delicious and very comforting and IT DOES IN FACT TASTE LIKE PIZZA. you could easily add some chopped pepperoni or even calabrian chili peppers if you wanted. As is though its a delicious recipe, reheats great and I will definitely be making it on occasion to satisfy my inner child!Riso al Forno alla Pizzaiola aka PIZZA RICE!Ingredients3 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil2 garlic cloves, minced6 to 7 fresh basil leaves, torn1/2 to 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper (optional)1 1/2 cups arborio rice1 1/2 cups tomato passata or tomato puréeSalt and pepper6 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, thinly sliced1/2 cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano Directions1. Heat oven to 350 degrees.2. In a medium saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium. Add the garlic, 3 of the torn basil leaves and the red pepper, if using. Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently to infuse the flavors and lightly brown the garlic.3. Add the rice and continue to stir for 3 minutes, just until the rice begins to crackle and toast. Add 1¼ cups tomato passata and mix to coat. Add 2½ cups of water, 1 teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon fresh cracked pepper and bring to a boil over medium.4. When the tomato mixture is boiling, turn down the heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes. Lift the lid and mix the rice every 5 minutes or so to prevent it from sticking to the bottom. After 20 minutes, remove it from the heat and stir in an additional ¼ cup of water and the remaining ¼ cup passata. (Your rice should look amply moist and creamy; it will continue to absorb more liquid as it bakes.)5. Grease an 8- or 9-inch baking dish with the remaining oil. Pour the rice mixture into the dish (it will still be very al dente). Press the mozzarella slices into the rice. Sprinkle the grated Parmigiano evenly over the top.6. Bake for 15 minutes in the middle of the oven. Then, move to the top rack and broil for 2 minutes. Remove from the oven, garnish with remaining basil and serve warm.

entry.title: Ginger Miso Brothy Soup with Crispy Shredded Tofu

link.title: Ginger Miso Brothy Soup with Crispy Shredded Tofu

entry.content:
this is the type of recipe that I feel like could instantly cure you from a case of the cold or sniffles. It has so many good things like ginger and lemon, comes together relatively quickly, and reheats super well! I'm having this for lunch every day this week and look forward to it every time :) 

Ginger Miso Brothy Soup with Sesame Shredded Tofu

 


Ingredients

Shredded Tofu

1lb block super firm tofu

1 1/2 tbsp tamari

1 tbsp rice vinegar

1 tbsp cornstarch

1 tbsp sesame seeds

1 1/2 tbsp avocado oil

 

Brothy Soup

2 tsp avocado oil

1/2 medium yellow onion

4 thin slices of fresh ginger root

5 cloves garlic, thinly sliced

1 Fresno pepper thinly sliced

3 scallions, thinly sliced with white and green ends separated

3 dried shiitake mushrooms

4 1/2 cups hot water

2 cups of vegetable or chicken broth

2–3 tbsp yellow miso paste

2 tsp sesame oil, plus more for serving

Juice and zest of half a lemon

Kosher salt, as needed

Cooked rice, for serving

 

1. Preheat oven to 425F. Line baking tray with parchment paper. Place a box grater over a baking tray and grate the tofu over the largest holes to create tofu shreds. Top the tofu with the tamari, vinegar, cornstarch, and sesame seeds then drizzle with oil. Coat then spread the shreds into a single layer on the tray. Bake in the oven for 15 mins then toss the shreds using tongs and bake again for 15 mins or until the shreds are brown and crispy.

 

2. Heat oil in a large pot over medium low heat. When hot, add the onion with a pinch of salt and saute for 5 mins or until the onions have started to soften and become golden in color. Add the ginger, garlic, pepper, and white part of scallions and continue to saute until fragrant, about 2 mins.

 

3. Add in the dried mushrooms and 3 1/2 cups water. Stir to combine, bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer for 15 mins.

 

4. While you wait, add the miso and the remaining 1 cup of water and sesame oil to a large glass measuring cup and whisk together until the miso is fully dissolved with no lumps.

 

5. Remove the mushrooms from the soup pot then pour in the miso mixture, the lemon zest and juice, and the chicken broth. Use an immersion blender to blend the broth smooth then stir in the remaining scallions.

 

6. To serve, add a scoop of rice to a serving bowl then ladle the broth around the rice. Top with the crispy tofu and garnish with sesame seeds, extra sesame oil, cilantro, more scallions, and another drizzle of tamari as desired.

 

https://www.instagram.com/reel/DCM44aYvJsE/
entry.summary: this is the type of recipe that I feel like could instantly cure you from a case of the cold or sniffles. It has so many good things like ginger and lemon, comes together relatively quickly, and reheats super well! I'm having this for lunch every day this week and look forward to it every time :) Ginger Miso Brothy Soup with Sesame Shredded Tofu

entry.title: Grilled Zucchini and Chicken Salad with Herbs

link.title: Grilled Zucchini and Chicken Salad with Herbs

entry.content:
This is a great summer recipe; I adapted it a little from the original to grill the zucchini rather than roast it in the oven. The goal with the zucchini is to get it nice and melty soft with a bit of char on it as well! Everything else including the dressing comes together super easily. I would store the dressing separately and combine with leftovers as you eat!


Roasted Zucchini Chicken Dill Salad

Ingredients

4 zucchini

1 lb chicken

olive oil

salt to taste

1 tbsp za’atar seasoning

1 large English cucumber diced

1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained

1/2 cup chopped dill

1/4 cup chopped mint

1/4 cup chopped basil

1 block feta cheese

 Dressing

1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil

1/4 cup apple cider vinegar

Juice 1 lemon

1 teaspoon dijon mustard

1 tbsp honey

1/2 tsp salt

 

Directions

  1. Halve the zucchini, then season with olive oil and salt to taste. Grill until soft/jammy. Cool slightly before chopping into pieces. Season chopped zucchini with salt and pepper to taste.
  2. Season chicken with olive oil, salt, and za’atar. Grill until fully cooked through, then chop into pieces.
  3. In a medium bowl add all dressing ingredients. Use an immersion blender or a whisk to combine.
  4. Add all the remaining salad ingredients to a serving bowl. Top with the vinaigrette and serve!
entry.summary: This is a great summer recipe; I adapted it a little from the original to grill the zucchini rather than roast it in the oven. The goal with the zucchini is to get it nice and melty soft with a bit of char on it as well! Everything else including the dressing comes together super easily. I would store the dressing separately and combine with leftovers as you eat!Roasted Zucchini Chicken Dill Salad

entry.title: Grilled Tofu
entry.content:
I don't know why I've never thought to try this before! Grilling tofu is super easy and an awesome way to add a little texture and pizzaz to tofu, and when paired with this marinade? Delicious! I ate this on bread with some japanese bbq sauce as a little sandwich as well as paired with the cold sesame soba, but you could also eat this over rice with veggies. Enjoy!

Grilled Tofu

Ingredients

1(14-ounce) block extra-firm tofu, sliced crosswise into eight equal slices (about ½-inch thick)

2 tablespoons safflower or canola oil, plus more for greasing grates

2 tablespoons minced garlic

1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger

⅓ cup low-sodium soy sauce

2 tablespoons turbinado sugar

½ teaspoon black pepper

2 tablespoons chopped scallions

 

Directions

1.      Arrange sliced tofu in a single layer on a paper towel-lined plate. Press top with more paper towels to remove excess water. Arrange tofu in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish, or any shallow dish that can hold the tofu in one layer.

2.      In a small saucepan, combine oil, garlic and ginger over medium; bring to a simmer. Cook, stirring frequently, until softened and fragrant, 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, sugar, pepper and ¼ cup water, and cook, stirring to dissolve the sugar, about 2 minutes.

3.      Pour hot marinade over tofu. Gently turn tofu slices to evenly coat, then cover dish tightly with plastic wrap to seal in heat. Refrigerate for 6 hours (or up to 8 hours), flipping tofu slices halfway through.

4.      Heat grill to medium and grease grates well (or heat a cast-iron grill pan over medium and lightly grease). Grill tofu over direct heat until golden and caramelized, about 3 minutes per side.

5.      Meanwhile, transfer marinade to a small saucepan over medium and warm through, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in scallions.

6.      Transfer tofu to a serving plate and spoon over the sauce. Serve warm.


https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1022297-grilled-tofu
entry.summary: I don't know why I've never thought to try this before! Grilling tofu is super easy and an awesome way to add a little texture and pizzaz to tofu, and when paired with this marinade? Delicious! I ate this on bread with some japanese bbq sauce as a little sandwich as well as paired with the cold sesame soba, but you could also eat this over rice with veggies. Enjoy!Grilled TofuIngredients1(14-ounce) block extra-firm tofu, sliced crosswise into eight equal slices (about ½-inch thick)2 tablespoons safflower or canola oil, plus more for greasing grates2 tablespoons minced garlic1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger⅓ cup low-sodium soy sauce2 tablespoons turbinado sugar½ teaspoon black pepper2 tablespoons chopped scallions Directions1.      Arrange sliced tofu in a single layer on a paper towel-lined plate. Press top with more paper towels to remove excess water. Arrange tofu in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish, or any shallow dish that can hold the tofu in one layer.2.      In a small saucepan, combine oil, garlic and ginger over medium; bring to a simmer. Cook, stirring frequently, until softened and fragrant, 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, sugar, pepper and ¼ cup water, and cook, stirring to dissolve the sugar, about 2 minutes.3.      Pour hot marinade over tofu. Gently turn tofu slices to evenly coat, then cover dish tightly with plastic wrap to seal in heat. Refrigerate for 6 hours (or up to 8 hours), flipping tofu slices halfway through.4.      Heat grill to medium and grease grates well (or heat a cast-iron grill pan over medium and lightly grease). Grill tofu over direct heat until golden and caramelized, about 3 minutes per side.5.      Meanwhile, transfer marinade to a small saucepan over medium and warm through, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in scallions.

entry.title: Oven Roasted Tomato and Hummus with Eggs

link.title: Oven Roasted Tomato and Hummus with Eggs

entry.content:
This recipe would make a great brunch option or as I ate it, a very light summer dinner! It is super easy to pull together and takes very little effort. The original recipe was for poached eggs but honestly I think a soft boiled or over easy egg is much easier and would be just as good, so that's what I included here. Enjoy!


Oven Roasted Tomato and Hummus with an Egg

Ingredients

1 pound cherry tomatoes

4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil

Kosher salt

1 tablespoon sweet white wine vinegar

Black pepper

2 tablespoons fresh soft herbs (basil, parsley, cilantro, or mint would all be great)

1/2 teaspoon Aleppo pepper or chile flakes

8 oz hummus

4 to 6 eggs

Pita, for serving

 

Directions

1.      Heat the oven to 425°F.

2.      To a quarter sheet pan, add the cherry tomatoes, 2 tablespoons olive oil and a pinch of salt. Toss everything to combine.

3.      Loosely cover the pan with a sheet of aluminum foil to prevent the tomatoes juices from bursting all over the oven.

4.      Place the pan in the oven and bake for 18 to 20 minutes, until the cherry tomatoes started to burst. Remove the foil from the pan. Turn the broiler on and broil the cherry tomatoes for 2 to 3 minutes, until slightly charred in certain spots.

5.      Add the roasted tomatoes and all their juices to a bowl. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, vinegar, a crack of black pepper, basil, and aleppo pepper or chile flakes and mix to combined.

6.      Swirl the hummus on a serving platter, creating a well in the center. Pile the roasted cherry tomatoes in the center.

7.      Cook eggs to your preference, either soft boiled (about 7 minutes in water), over easy, or poached. Slide eggs onto platter with tomatoes and hummus. 

8.      Serve with warm pita on the side.
entry.summary: This recipe would make a great brunch option or as I ate it, a very light summer dinner! It is super easy to pull together and takes very little effort. The original recipe was for poached eggs but honestly I think a soft boiled or over easy egg is much easier and would be just as good, so that's what I included here. Enjoy!Oven Roasted Tomato and Hummus with an Egg

entry.title: Cold Soba Salad with Spicy Peanut Sauce

link.title: Cold Soba Salad with Spicy Peanut Sauce

entry.content:
It's officially the summer of soba: I know of at least one other soba recipe that's going to be showing up here soon but we are kicking off with a banger of a recipe in this cold soba salad. The sauce is so creamy, sweet, and spicy to your taste and packs in a bunch of veggies. You can totally customize the veggie mix to whatever you have lying around or your personal preference; I'm not really a radish fan so I used turnip instead and its delicious. The roasted nuts on top are a must, and this all comes together super quickly for a great summer dinner! This recipe is also naturally gluten free and vegan - can't beat that!

Cold Soba Salad With Spicy
Peanut Sauce

Ingredients

For The Salad

Kosher salt

10 ounces soba noodles

1 medium zucchini or cucumber (about 6 ounces)

5 radishes (about 4 ounces) or one medium turnip (could sub cabbage here too)

1 bell pepper (any color)

1 tablespoon sesame oil

½ cup roasted salted peanuts (about 2 ounces), roughly chopped

2 scallions, trimmed and finely chopped

Handful of cilantro leaves

1 lime, cut into wedges for serving

For The Spicy Peanut Sauce

½cup smooth peanut butter (not natural)

¼ cup soy sauce

2 tablespoons maple syrup

2 tablespoons lime juice (from 1 lime)

1 tablespoon sesame oil

2 teaspoons chile oil or hot sauce, plus more to taste

1 garlic clove, grated

 

Directions


1.      Cut the zucchini or cucumber and radishes into ⅛-inch thick slices (use a mandolin if you have one), then cut into thin matchsticks. Slice the peppers into ⅛-inch pieces. Place them all in a large bowl.

2.      Bring a pot of salted water to the boil. Add the soba, stir to prevent sticking, and cook according to package instructions until just tender. Rinse under cold water until the noodles are completely cold.

3.      Meanwhile, make the sauce: In a medium bowl, combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, maple syrup, lime juice, sesame oil, chile oil or hot sauce, and garlic. Add ¼ to ½ cup water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and whisk until the sauce is a pourable consistency. Taste and add more chile oil or hot sauce as desired; set aside.

4.      Loosen the soba noodles by running them under some water, then allow to drain again. Add them to the vegetables, add the remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil and toss to combine.

5.      When you are ready to serve, drizzle with spicy peanut sauce and top with peanuts, scallions and cilantro. Serve immediately, with lime wedges alongside.
entry.summary: It's officially the summer of soba: I know of at least one other soba recipe that's going to be showing up here soon but we are kicking off with a banger of a recipe in this cold soba salad. The sauce is so creamy, sweet, and spicy to your taste and packs in a bunch of veggies. You can totally customize the veggie mix to whatever you have lying around or your personal preference; I'm not really a radish fan so I used turnip instead and its delicious. The roasted nuts on top are a must, and this all comes together super quickly for a great summer dinner! This recipe is also naturally gluten free and vegan - can't beat that!Cold Soba Salad With Spicy Peanut Sauce

entry.title: 🔔 Jingle Tits Spritz 🔔
entry.content:
warning, this cocktail is delicious and dangerous in equal measure. It's a perfect winter citrus holiday cocktail that you can scale up and mix ahead of time (minus ice) in a pitcher and let everyone pour them and top with bubbles, It has three sources of alcohol so its much more boozy than it tastes, and it does lean sweet. If you like your cocktails a bit more acidic I would increase your lemon juice just a tad. Enjoy!


Jingle T*ts Spritz

Ingredients

0.75oz Gin

0.5oz Aperol

0.5oz Simple Syrup

0.5oz Lemon

1oz Mandarin Orange Juice

Finish with bubbles (prosecco, champagne, cava, or even soda water)

 

Directions

1. Mix gin, Aperol, simple syrup, lemon juice, and mandarin orange juice in a cocktail shaker. Fill 2/3 with ice and shake until frosted

2. Strain into a glass and top with bubbles of your choice
entry.summary: warning, this cocktail is delicious and dangerous in equal measure. It's a perfect winter citrus holiday cocktail that you can scale up and mix ahead of time (minus ice) in a pitcher and let everyone pour them and top with bubbles, It has three sources of alcohol so its much more boozy than it tastes, and it does lean sweet. If you like your cocktails a bit more acidic I would increase your lemon juice just a tad. Enjoy!Jingle T*ts Spritz

entry.title: Tofu Salad for Lettuce or Seaweed Wraps

link.title: Tofu Salad for Lettuce or Seaweed Wraps

entry.content:
This is the simplest meal prep you'll find! Really easy to throw together and tweak flavoring to your preference, and goes great with some rice, avocado, and either dried seaweed or lettuce leaves for little wraps! I'm definitely having it for lunch all week, but would make a great summertime dinner too :)\

Tofu Salad for Lettuce or Seaweed Wraps

 
Ingredients:

1 block (~450g) very firm tofu
1 avocado (you'll need a second avocado for serving)
3 baby cucumbers, finely diced
3 scallions, finely sliced
1 ½ tbsp soy sauce, tamari, or teriyaki sauce

3 tbsp kewpie mayo (regular mayo would work)
3-4 tsp crispy chili oil

 

For serving

2-3 packs toasted seaweed or lettuce
1 avocado, sliced
white rice

Directions:
 1. Grate the tofu on a box grater. You won’t have to press hard for the tofu to grate, and it doesn’t have to be perfect.

2. Mix the tofu, 1 mashed avocado, cucumber, scallion, soy sauce, mayo, and chili oil. Taste and season with salt and adjust with any of the other sauces to your personal preference.

3.  Serve with rice and sliced avocado as well as dried seaweed or lettuce to make bite sized wraps. enjoy!
entry.summary: This is the simplest meal prep you'll find! Really easy to throw together and tweak flavoring to your preference, and goes great with some rice, avocado, and either dried seaweed or lettuce leaves for little wraps! I'm definitely having it for lunch all week, but would make a great summertime dinner too :)\Tofu Salad for Lettuce or Seaweed Wraps Ingredients: 1 block (~450g) very firm tofu1 avocado (you'll need a second avocado for serving) 3 baby cucumbers, finely diced 3 scallions, finely sliced 1 ½ tbsp soy sauce, tamari, or teriyaki sauce 3 tbsp kewpie mayo (regular mayo would work)3-4 tsp crispy chili oil For serving2-3 packs toasted seaweed or lettuce1 avocado, slicedwhite riceDirections: 1. Grate the tofu on a box grater. You won’t have to press hard for the tofu to grate, and it doesn’t have to be perfect.2. Mix the tofu, 1 mashed avocado, cucumber, scallion, soy sauce, mayo, and chili oil. Taste and season with salt and adjust with any of the other sauces to your personal preference.3.  Serve with rice and sliced avocado as well as dried seaweed or lettuce to make bite sized wraps. enjoy!

entry.title: Caesar-y Brussel Sprout Salad with Za’atar Chickpeas

link.title: Caesar-y Brussel Sprout Salad with Za’atar Chickpeas

entry.content:
This is a super good winter salad recipe! I love a baked salad and this one is a nice spin on classic caesar that's a little healthier and tastier in my opinion. If you make the full amount of brussel sprouts or cabbage it'll probably take 4 sheet pans, so I'd plan on doing two rotations in the oven. You could easily cut it in half with a smaller cabbage or fewer sprouts, and it'd probably make 2 servings. enjoy!

Caesar-y Brussel Sprout Salad with Za’atar Chickpeas

-serves 4-


Ingredients

1 (15-ounce) can of chickpeas

1-2 heaping tsp za'atar seasoning

2 & 1/2 lbs brussel sprouts or cabbage

Olive oil as needed

Kosher salt & fresh cracked black pepper as needed

1 2oz tin anchovies, oil packed

2 cloves garlic minced or grated with a microplane

1/2 cup tahini

1 lemon

1/2 cup flat leaf parsley, roughly chopped

1/4 cup cold water

1/2 ounce freshly grated parmesan optional, for topping

 

Directions

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F.

2. Drain and rinse the chickpeas. Dry them well before adding them to a food processor. Pulse until they form chickpea "crumbs." Spread these out evenly on a baking sheet. Generously drizzle the chickpea crumbs with olive oil, toss in the za'atar and season with salt. Toss with your hands until everything is coated. Bake for 25-30 minutes until dry and crisp while you prep your brussel sprouts/cabbage.

3. Thinly slice the brussel sprouts (mandolin works great here) and add them to baking sheets. You want them to have enough space on the pan to breathe and crisp up, so feel free to use a couple of baking sheets. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

4. Once the chickpeas come out of the oven, put the brussel sprouts in and bake for 20-22 minutes.

While the brussel sprouts are roasting, make the anchovy tahini sauce.

5. Put a small saucepan on medium low heat. Add in just the oil from the tin of anchovies, and let it heat up. Then add the anchovies to the pan, they should immediately sizzle and begin to "melt" into the oil.

Add the grated garlic into the pan with the anchovy oil. Cook on medium heat for 2-3 minutes or until you can no longer taste any raw garlic. This will look like a thick paste.

6. Add this paste, the tahini, the juice from one lemon, and the parsley to a blender or food processor. Blend to combine. It will get thick, so add water to dilute the mixture into a dressing.

7. Remove the greens from the oven. Drizzle a good amount of the dressing onto the greens and give them a toss.

8. To serve, pile the greens into bowls. Sprinkle the chickpea crumbles on top. Grate on some freshly grated parmesan. Serve immediately.
entry.summary: This is a super good winter salad recipe! I love a baked salad and this one is a nice spin on classic caesar that's a little healthier and tastier in my opinion. If you make the full amount of brussel sprouts or cabbage it'll probably take 4 sheet pans, so I'd plan on doing two rotations in the oven. You could easily cut it in half with a smaller cabbage or fewer sprouts, and it'd probably make 2 servings. enjoy!Caesar-y Brussel Sprout Salad with Za’atar Chickpeas
